ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] grouping thread on the Everquest boards
ygData.msgSnippet: If this is the case then the z-axis thing truly is a bug and not simply a feature of the system architecture.  There is really no reason one spells AoE should
ygData.messageBody:
If this is the case then the z-axis thing truly is a bug and not simply a
feature of the system architecture. There is really no reason one spells
AoE should behave any differently than another's except for bugs. Do wizard
AoE damage spells agro creatures below or above them like ours do?

Kitasi

My experience with Largo's is that it is safe to sing in dungeon settings.
The radius of the AE is small enough that it will only effect the mobs you
are attacking. I have never noticed it aggroing mobs thru walls or in rooms
above/below you. I don't think the z-axis bug comes into play with this
song. I have this song memmed all the time when there is a ranger/druid or
when there is no shaman in the group.

Galtin of E'ci
39 bard

-----Original Message-----
From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
Sent: Wednesday, June 28, 2000 10:20 AM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] grouping thread on the Everquest boards


Is Largo's safe in Dalnir's? I was hesitant to use it given the three
levels in Dalnir's. Has anyone else had this song causing mobs to teleport
to them or cast on them from different levels?
